Class RectangleElement

Namespace
FlowGraph.Core.Elements.Shapes
Assembly
FlowGraph.Core.dll

A rectangle shape element that can be rendered on the canvas.

public class RectangleElement : ShapeElement, ICanvasElement, INotifyPropertyChanged

Examples

// Create a swimlane background
var swimlane = new RectangleElement("swimlane-1")
{
    Position = new Point(0, 0),
    Width = 300,
    Height = 600,
    Fill = "#ecf0f1",
    Stroke = "#bdc3c7",
    StrokeWidth = 2,
    CornerRadius = 4,
    Label = "Development"
};

Remarks

Rectangles are one of the most common shape elements, useful for: - Swimlanes in process diagrams - Containers/groups without the node behavior - Annotations and labels - Background regions

Constructors

RectangleElement()

Creates a new rectangle element with a generated ID.

public RectangleElement()

RectangleElement(string)

Creates a new rectangle element with the specified ID.

public RectangleElement(string id)

Parameters

id string

The unique identifier for this rectangle.

Properties

CornerRadius

Gets or sets the corner radius for rounded rectangles. A value of 0 creates sharp corners.

public double CornerRadius { get; set; }

Property Value

double

Type

Gets the type identifier for this element.

public override string Type { get; }

Property Value

string

Remarks

Used by renderer registries to select the appropriate renderer. For nodes, this typically comes from the node definition's Type property. For shapes, this identifies the shape type (line, rectangle, text, etc.).
